  • Description: 1. X-2023061572 SequenceEvent: Loose caps caused internal leakage, the box was retrieved and the spill was contained. DescribePack: Loose caps on bottles inside of the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: sand was used to contain the spill and the was package was put into a salvage drum. 2. X-2023061581 SequenceEvent: The package was wet from internal leakage due to the caps on the bottles being loose, the package fell apart before being placed on the non conveyable belt DescribePack: loose caps on the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill was contained and put into a salvage drum. 3. X-2023061583 SequenceEvent: The package was discovered leaking on the NC belt and was pulled off DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: sand was used to contain and clean up the spill, afterwards all contents were put into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023060797
item.description:
Report E-2023060797

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, one (1) one-gallon jug of UN3266 appeared to be defective and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted surface. HES personnel arrived and assessed the site. The amount of product released was so small, it had only impacted the cardboard box, and the product had already dried, so R+L personnel wanted to ship the product as is. HES personnel identified the cause of the leak as the lids not being properly screwed on. Crews tightened the lids and tested them to see that they did not leak any further

item.title: Report E-2023060719
item.description:
Report E-2023060719

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: CARTERSVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NRG experienced a UN3265 E5 Catalyst release from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were then containerized into a 95-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023060678
item.description:
Report E-2023060678

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: THOMSON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 22, 2023, at 1557 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Thomason, Georgia regarding the release of approximately 80 gallons of Neutrall 25 (Corrosive liquid, n.o.s., UN1706, 8, II) from (2) 275-gallon plastic totes. The release was reportedly due to the totes being crushed and affected the entirety of the trailer floor and continued on to a 150' x 9' area of asphalt parking lot. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and neutralizer and transfer any remaining product into new undamaged totes. All waste generated from this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon plastic totes, which were then taken along with the (2) damaged 275-gallon plastic totes for proper disposal by the contractor.

X-2023061285 SequenceEvent: The box was discovered damaged from internal leakage DescribePack: loose caps on all of the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: sand was used to stop the leak.
